snippet: The former Communist nation has completed 20 miles of fence along its border with Turkey, and plans to extend it to 100 miles, to stem the flow of refugees.
abstract: Bulgaria is constructing extensive wall along its border with Turkey to stem flow of refugees from Middle East and North Africa; structure could span 100 miles before completion; move highlights increasing agitation across Europe concerning surge in immigration, and economic, social and political issues it has brought with it; some 200,000 refugees penetrated continent in 2014, and rate has only increased in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The former Communist nation has completed 20 miles of fence along its border with Turkey, and plans to extend it to 100 miles, to stem the flow of refugees.

headline.main: Bulgaria Puts Up a New Wall, but This One Keeps People Out
headline.print_headline: Bulgaria Puts Up a New Wall, but This One Keeps People Out
